Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (81.82%) toRF2R=F: 27%.  GRAVY: -0.259; M Wt:   2967.615; Mol formula:  C142H209N42O25S2; molar extinction coeff: 5675.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or UB1005 or K88 or K99 strains (MIC 1-2 uM), S. pullorum 7913 (MIC 2 uM),  S. enterica serovar Typhimurium C7731 or 14208 (MIC 2 uM), P. aeruginosa 27853 (MIC 2 uM), S. choleraesuis CVCC503 (MIC 2 uM), S. aureus ATCC 29213 or 29523 or MRSA 43300 (MIC 2-4 uM), S. epidermidis 12228 (MIC 1 uM), and E. faecalis 29212 (MIC 1 uM).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (150 mM salt); KCl-insensitive:E. coli (4.5 mM salt); NH4Cl-insensitive:E. coli (6 uM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli (1 mM salt); CaCl2-sensitive:E. coli (2 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:E. coli (8 uM salt); FeCl3-insensitive:E. coli (4 uM salt); Salt-insensitive:S. aureus: NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus (150 mM salt); KCl-insensitive:S. aureus (4.5 mM salt); NH4Cl-insensitive:S. aureus (6 uM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (1 mM salt); CaCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (2 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (8 uM salt); FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus (4 uM salt.Toxicity: 10% hemo-lytic concentration 32 uM.
